meanings.definition: Unable to sail due to adverse wind conditions.
meanings.sent1: The sailors were windbound and couldn't continue their journey.
meanings.sent2: The ship remained windbound in the harbor until the storm passed.
meanings.sent3: The windbound boat looked like a sad, forgotten toy in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of adventure were temporarily windbound by the storm.
meanings.sent5: The windbound ship creaked and groaned against the relentless gusts.

meanings.definition: Delayed or hindered by unfavorable winds.
meanings.sent1: The windbound travelers had to wait for the wind to change direction.
meanings.sent2: The hot air balloon was windbound, unable to make progress towards its destination.
meanings.sent3: The windbound kite danced erratically in the sky, much to the amusement of onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her plans were windbound by unexpected obstacles, causing frustration.
meanings.sent5: The windbound leaves rustled in protest as the gusts refused to let them go.

meanings.definition: Stuck or stranded due to strong winds.
meanings.sent1: The windbound hikers sought shelter from the powerful gusts.
meanings.sent2: The tent was securely anchored to prevent it from becoming windbound.
meanings.sent3: The windbound flag flapped wildly, as if trying to escape its pole.
meanings.sent4: The windbound birds struggled to maintain their course in the turbulent skies.
meanings.sent5: The windbound branches swayed dangerously, threatening to snap at any moment.
